website_summaries.verdict: This is the classic George Foreman model that put the company on the map. Still a great bargain and handy appliance for small kitchens.
pros: Drip tray catches up to 42% of excess grease
Dual contact heating for faster results
cons: Teflon coating is not durable, so food will stick to plates

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen classic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old George Foreman grill - I’m single so I didn’t need/want a big bulky appliance. I was dead set on getting this classic, no nonsense size - I love it! It fits my lifestyle perfectly! Burgers, chicken, steak tips, ribeyes in minutes- cooked perfectly, delicious and cleans and stores in a snap!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: I've almost pushed T-Bone steak in - check out pictures
customer_reviews.text: T-Bone steak was really too much, BUT only because of the bone which obviously did not squeeze with temperature and cooking became less even so I had to remove it and finish separate pieces. Non the less it has almost done the job and for other single serve patty/bagel/toast/vegetables it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Igor P.

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectible quality and performance for a George Foreman grill.
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed. I had a George Foreman grill and roaster for many years. Brought this one expecting the same quality and performance but the first time I used it my hamburgers were burnt on outside and not fully cook on the inside. Tried to clean the grill it was difficult and some of the burnt meat I was unable to remove without using a pad with a rough surface. This was not the quality I expect from George Foreman product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Horry

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality item
customer_reviews.text: The "anti-stick" coating only last 2.5 months. I never used metal or abrasives on this thing. And even when new, the anti-stick was not all that anti-sticking. I am shocked this thing was such poor quality. I had a walmart knock-off before this thing that cost $5 bucks less, and that grille was a champ and always super easy to clean. I accidentally left it behind at a hotel. Hope i can find one like it again, because i will never buy a GF product again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Things You Should Know
customer_reviews.text: Things you should know: 1. There is no on/off switch (plug it in to turn it on. Unplug it to turn it off) 2. It's easy to clean, but easier to clean if you clean it while unplugged and still hot or warm 3. You can grill at least four hotdogs at a time 4. You can only grill one sandwich at a time 5. You can only grill one burger at a time 6. Makes life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This the perfect size for someone living alone. I've been wanting a George Foreman for a long time but they were all to big for me and harder to store. I haven't had to worry about storing it now.. It lives on my countertop because I use it almost everyday. I don't have get my frying pan out all the time , It's easy to use and clean. I can even do Panini's ! Best thing I've gotten for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Lover

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely terrible. It only heats completely in the center. Anything around the edges remains uncooked unless you stand over it and move it around to cook it evenly. I have used this product only three times, and the coating is already coming off (shown in the picture on the tips). I’m so disappointed in this product. I will never buy George Foreman again.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great for single portion or panini press
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a four because it can only cook one portion at a time. My last grill could cook two. Same company. It's great as a panini press. It does chicken and burgers great. It doesn't do steak too good though. Dogs and sausages are a bust. If you like grilled chicken for salads this thing is a must. When you clean it make sure it's still hot. A wet sponge does great. Just don't use the green side because it will scrape off the non-stick surface.
customer_reviews.author: brian bishop

customer_reviews.title: Fake. Not a real Foreman grill.
customer_reviews.text: I definitely received a fake Foreman grill. It was missing parts, did not have the Foreman signature on it, and even worse, anything and everything sticks to it and you darn near need a chisel to get anything off of this to clean it. Extremely disappointed to have been taken like this.
customer_reviews.author: Proud Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grill for my boyfriend after we moved in together! Small grill which makes 1 sandwich out of time. I love how easy it is to use, and how easy it is to clean. Perfect for a single person or a couple! Does not stink, and its doesn’t take a long time to get the job done! Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Foreman grill with this new small one and am very satisfied. I grilled sandwiches, chicken breasts and steaks very satisfactorily. One any needs to take the time to learn how long to grill each food item. Not a long process. Thick steaks, i.e., 1.5-2" are easiest because you can monitor them readily. Thin cutlets of all meats are a bit more of a challenge because the heating is from top and bottom. I found 2-3 minutes for those are often enough.
customer_reviews.author: WWTRAVELER

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to the original...
customer_reviews.text: George Foreman 2-Serving Classic Plate Electric Indoor Grill and Panini Press, Black, GR10B Very similar to the original, except in black. It's so cheap, when the teflon finally wears off, throw it out and buy a new one. Does a great job cooking a thick burger, with the grill mashing in both sides of the meat. No problem making a well done, medium, or less, meal. I couldn't find any competition on the market, especially when you consider that this thing is 760 watts for a small machine. Love it...
customer_reviews.author: Victor H. Agresti

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy for Kitchens!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using George Foreman grills for years. I recently purchased this model to replace a similar one that was about 5 years old - it was worn out! This grill heats up quickly, the food comes out great, the no-stick surface keeps you from needing to use any anti-stick spray (pam) and it's easy to clean! I can start wiping off the surface with a paper towel or sponge within a few minutes of turning off the grill - the grease comes right off. You can wash the drip tray in the dish washer. I'm very happy with this purchase and hope to use the grill for the next 5 years (at least!).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Faber

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for two people. It does cook fast but I've found that the outside of my steaks burn before the inside is cooked past medium rare. Since my husband likes well done, I cut the meat as thin as possible so it doesn't have to cook as long. I have also found that I need to put any seasonings on after it's cooked or the seasoning burns even quicker. I still use it though because it's the best at making sure all the fat runs off into the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Terri S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill in Jan 2015 and have used it nearly every day since. It’s still going strong! It’s one of the best purchases I’ve ever made. It heats up extremely quickly, and cooks quickly as well. The only con I can think of is that it really is only large enough to do one serving of whatever you’re cooking (hamburger patty, chicken breast, sandwich, etc.). Either way, I HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone in the market for a small grill!
customer_reviews.author: Kynzi Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage! I bought this to replace an older geo foreman unit and the quality has declined 90%. This is junk. Lightweight, grill lines have almost no relief, smaller grill area, cooks unevenly, smokes and smells like burnt plastic. Returned after one use, save your time and spend the extra money for something more substantial. This brand used to be gold standard and is now trash
customer_reviews.author: 65cyclista

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a single serving grill.
customer_reviews.text: I really like that you can put a frozen party in it and not touch it till it's done. The plates don't come off so it's just a wipe off with paper towel like a cast iron. My only major issue is that it says 2 serving size. It does not fit tl2 standard frozen patties.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Souza

customer_reviews.title: Simple but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple item to grill a cheese sandwich, a burger, a piece of salmon or chicken for one person. The price was right, the item was simple to use. Done. No temperature control - doesn't bother me. No on and off switch - doesn't bother me - I unplug it. Can't put it in the sink or dishwasher to clean. Very easy to clean on the counter.. Works for me. it saves me from using and cleaning my oven. I don't outdoor grill.
customer_reviews.author: Anima

customer_reviews.title: Easy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: It works great to drain out fat and cook single or double serving meats, like a big steak or a chicken breast. You can also cook veggies no problem Only thing is you can't regulate temp, so be sure to check on your food so it doesn't burn. Tray doesn't detach, so I like to wipe it down pretty much right after I'm done cooking. That way, the grwase and food slide off while the grill is hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIKED MINE SO MUCH I ORDERED ONE FOR MY SON....
customer_reviews.text: THEN MY BROTHER AND MOM LIKED MINE SO MUCH I LET THEM TAKE IT. I HAD OWNED A LARGER MODEL BEFORE THIS SMALLER ONE. I COULD FIT THREE NORMAL SIZE BURGERS ON THIS GRILL. WE TRIED PANNI SANDWICHES AND MY BROTHER WAS HOOKED. I ALSO COOKED CHICKEN TENDERS FOR OUR 91 YEAR OLD MOTHER. COOKED EXTRA TENDERS AND MADE CHICKEN SALAD FOR HER THE NEXT DAY. ENJOY LIFE
customer_reviews.author: Catsroses

customer_reviews.title: Realistically for 1 Person
customer_reviews.text: This is good for one person. Does one large Burger, or one small steak, or 1 and 1/2 chicken breasts. The temperature seems to be centered in the middle so to get even cooking you need to make sure that whatever it is you're cooking goes in the middle. *Update- After a few months, the heat is no longer distributed evenly and only cooks in the middle with browning occurring only on the top due to the weight of the lid. Use a pan for steak!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy McCargo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the non chef like me!
customer_reviews.text: I literally use it every day. I've used the same one every day for over 5 years. If you don't own one, click buy now. Chicken, wraps, burgers, half-quesadillas, sausages, etc. I mean it's 5-10 minutes and done!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: First try went well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little grill, however, it is a bit of a chore to clean it, and the top is a little flimsy. You can fit two burgers at a table me and it cooks them faster than just cooking them in a skillet. I think it took me 6-8 minutes, with no flipping of the burger involved. All in all it is a good product but I have only used it once so far.
customer_reviews.author: B.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for one
customer_reviews.text: This is just right for me. I had a bigger one for years and it was great. I have a grandson in college, so I gave that one to him and got this smaller one for me. It is just the right size for what I want to cook in it. Great for burgers, fish and chicken. The only thing that does not cook great in this type grill is a bone-in steak of pork chop. The bone prevents the grill from touching the meat evenly, I love it and will be using it quite often.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaB

customer_reviews.title: Great for Singles
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these last black Friday and have used it almost every day since then. So when a friend of mine moved into her new home and talked about her love for grilled fish and asparagus, I knew what I had to do. This is a great little grill for housewarming singles. Easy to clean. Not too heavy as with some of the other grills. Now we compare what we are cooking with George :)
customer_reviews.author: Houston Music

customer_reviews.title: A great kitchen staple
customer_reviews.text: GREAT price point and easy to use! It heats up quickly and cooks the food well! I have used it to grill chicken so far. It did have a slight plasticky smell when I first used it but it went away pretty quickly and did not transfer to the food. I have been using it nightly since I got it and so far I have been very pleased. It was easy to clean up after and made cooking the chicken an easy task.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had an old one for more than 10 years. It got scratched and I got this one. It’s basically the same but lighter so I have to keep it in mind when I use it. It does it’s job well and is easy to use but cleaning is a pain. I wrap it up after each use with paper towel and some parts inside the top lid don’t clean completely. I was surprised that the instructions didn’t have any hints on how to do it better. All in all I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for single meal and veggie products!
customer_reviews.text: Before I begin... not that this is a VERY small grill (which is what I was looking for). I used it to make grilled sandwiches, veggie burgers (2 at a time for morning star type sized, 1 for a large one). I am the only vegan in my house. It is perfect for me. If you cook (meat) burgers, steaks , chicken breasts, etc ; get a larger version. My husband loves his grill!
customer_reviews.author: Gloryanne

customer_reviews.title: Catches Fire!
customer_reviews.text: This item immediately started smoking from the back, within 10 seconds of plugging it in. I tried three times and became immediately worried that it would explode in my face as the lead is so short. I pulled the plug out quickly and stepped away. I was so focused on the back-steam that I didn't take a photo
customer_reviews.author: John Dawson

customer_reviews.title: My second grill...still loving it
customer_reviews.text: I had an older George Foreman grill some time ago but somehow it was lost in our move a couple of years ago. I’m on a high protein diet now and this grill is perfect for quickly cooking up turkey burgers or chicken breasts without a big fuss. I bought it for me...but my spouse uses it all the time too. We almost need two so we don’t have to schedule our cooking times!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Busto

customer_reviews.title: Not for 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace our old 2 serving "Foreman Lean Mean Fat Grilling Machine" - We've had and used it for over 15 years and it always was great. BUT the surface cooking area on the new 2-servicing Foreman grill is much smaller in depth. (Width is about the same.) Soon as we opened it, I realized it I could not get 2 servings on the cook area and it would have to go back. Too Bad
customer_reviews.author: Pbear-Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Get It!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Its the perfect size for the single persons kitchen. Easy to clean and heats up quickly and to a high temperature. Highly recommend to first timers or people who don't want to grill outside in cold weather
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1 or 2 Person Meals!
customer_reviews.text: I use this several times a week. It is easy to use, just plug it in, wait for light to indicate it is hot and ready to use and grill! A little spray oil helps but is not necessary. Super easy to clean also! I grill chicken, steak and even use it for quesadillas (fold tortilla in half to fit). It holds 1-2 pieces of meat and 1 quesadilla at a time but only takes minutes to cook. I only wish there was an on/off switch as you must remember to unplug when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Diadra

customer_reviews.title: Saves on cleaning stove.
customer_reviews.text: I use this frequently as it is easier to clean the grill than my stove. When I clean it I put it on for one minute so the grease easily wipes right off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grill as I am single and only cooking for one it’s great. Definitely easy to clean I put three stars for Temperature control as there is none. It heats up fast and it’s a healthier way to prepare your food has the grease runs out into the drip bowl. No splattery mess all over the stove anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Miller

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product a one star rating for poor quality. The nonstick started to come off after just two uses. I owned a George foreman grill years ago and the quality was much better than this one. Please be aware if you purchase this grill based on past experience with GF grills this is not the same quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Works, but poor build quality and hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Overall this device performs about as well as I expected it to. However, comparing this version to older Foreman grills this one feels cheap, plasticky, and poorly constructed. Cleaning often takes longer than actually cooking, so the time savings from using this device is severely reduced. You also have to be very careful when cleaning it to avoid damaging the non-stick surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my daughter and she seems to love it very much. As usual with Prime the shipping was fast and on time. The product was as described, great price and I'm very pleased with the quality of product. I am very likely to buy again and will recommend to anyone looking for a Similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Geore Foreman 2 serving Classic Place Elec. Indoor Grill.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new George Foreman 2 serving Classic Plate Electric Grill. It is the perfect size for 1 person. I use it every day to cook one small pc. of salmon. I love the size of this Foreman. I do not use it in the house because I have a covered outdoor porch attached to my kitchen. The price was great so I bought a spare just in case I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeane M Minyard

customer_reviews.title: Great for Everything I've Cooked.
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my old one the I've used for years so I'm obviously "sold" on the concept. Easy to use...I only wish it had a temperature setting or timer and that it was easier to clean thoroughly. A big bonus is that it cooks both sides at the same time.....evenly, so when it's done (no flipping), you're ready to eat!
customer_reviews.author: Humanist

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: This item is listed as a two serving grill. The grill is only big enough for one piece of chicken or burger in my opinion. I’m disappointed in the size but otherwise it is a good product. We bought this one to replace our other one, which must have been a 4 serving model because it’s bigger but actually fits two pieces of chicken. I wish it was easier to clean the grill part but you have to unscrew them
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy meal prep & clean. Excellent investment!
customer_reviews.text: I like the versatility of this piece of kitchen equipment & the easy clean-up afterward! I've cooked grilled cheese & other sandwiches on it; hamburgers; ground turkey burgers; & chicken breasts (cut in half length-wise for more even cooking). I liked the one I had already so much, that I bought another one for my son who has just recently 'flown the nest'. My other college aged kids have also been experimenting with it & actually using it & liking how easy it is all-around.
customer_reviews.author: Truffles

customer_reviews.title: Probably best for sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: I like that this George Foreman grill is small. I don't have a huge apartment, so it basically helps me keep my waffles toasty. That's a plus. What I hate about it is that it takes a while to get my food toasted and it leaves things a tiny bit moist. Even though it puts grill marks on food, it doesn't make your meat taste grilled. I think this is definitely more of a panini press. Which is fine for me because that's all I really wanted it for anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bye Felicia

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The patty in the picture is 1/3 lb. (same as most patties at the supermarket). As you can see, there is no way this is two serving for that size patty. I would doubt that it would fit two 1/4 lb patties either, since it is not close to fitting 1/3 lb. Maybe two sliders.
customer_reviews.author: Cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: George Foreman great prodluc
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item for years, since it first came out. My first and second grills lasted for years. I am excited to see that you can still get this product. I do not grill outside but I don't have to. This small grill satisfies what I need. Thanks George!
customer_reviews.author: dallas1

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Basement Deficiencies
customer_reviews.text: Extremely short power cord, and disappointed I cannot fit two average sized hamburger patties at the same time. Otherwise, it's cheap and aight.
customer_reviews.author: Rebootin' Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one person
customer_reviews.text: I've had a family size George Foreman grill for over 25 years, but it's way too big and bulky and yes I still use it. I decided to get this small one that I could keep on my countertop all the time that's good just for me if I wanted to grill chicken for a salad or make a single burger it's just the right size. So that being said I'm very happy I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: sweet girl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not made to last. Its flimsy, and feels plain shoddy. I have owned two in the past and they do not make these like they first did. I will never buy another George Forman grill again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for 1or 2 items but isn’t easy to clean because the plates don’t come off like the big George Forman grill. Googled for ideas on how to clean them and those work well. Kinda cheap plastic top and bottom of the grill itself. Overall not bad for the $18.
customer_reviews.author: Zuziezu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for the traveler in a truck or RV
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact. The plates don't remove like the larger models. Grills my steaks, chicken and fish. I use this in my travels. It's only 700w. If you're wanting one for home use, I get a larger one with the removable grill plates to allow for easier cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 servings!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! Fits two burgers at a time. I also like that it comes with a little cookbook. No complaints! Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: bernie koter

customer_reviews.title: Don't Go Here
customer_reviews.text: With this product you must pre-heat for 4 minutes, use potholders to open, and there is no grilling temperature setting; it's either off or on. Look for something better, especially if there are children around.
customer_reviews.author: Sputz

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it for work
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to clean because I don't have to, he does. Its easy to use because I don't have to, he does. Its pretty durable however when knocked off a tool box it will break though it does last for at least ten years as long as it is not knocked off a tool box. Great for when the wife does not want to cook or your at work and your hungry so you cook yourself up a burger and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: AR Grover

customer_reviews.title: Nice little grill... with some issues
customer_reviews.text: Works well, cooks good, perfect for my RV. But build quality is low. Bits of plastic rattled around inside until I removed grills. The bottom frame was out of shape so that it wobbled on the counter surface. All in all, OK for the price, but not a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Darby

customer_reviews.title: It's reputation of being a great product
customer_reviews.text: I have an older 2-serving indoor grill which the non-stick material was wearing off after so many years of use. I bought this George Foreman 2-serving indoor grill because of it's reputation of being a great product and the size is perfect for me. Easy to use and easy to clean even if sometimes I have to use a little elbow grease to remove dried on meat.
customer_reviews.author: Tmom

customer_reviews.title: perfect little indoor grill for one person
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. It is not too bad to clean, just have to wait until it cools and lean into the sink to wipe off or use soapy water. I may end up getting the larger one with the removable plates to clean, but this works for now. And the price is really good. I use it regularly so definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austin

customer_reviews.title: Tiny grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and her boyfriend who just got an apartment. This was much smaller than I expected. I have a larger one for myself which I guess much be a 4 person, but I can only make 2 burgers on it. So I thought I was ordering the same size. I ended up giving my old one to the kids and kept this small one for myself. Good for a quick small sandwich on my own. Otherwise I’ll just use my outdoor. grill.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Krause

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I love this little grill I used it for the first and burned my burger mainly because it's a new thing I haven't used or had anything similar, so it cooked my burger faster than I expected. I even grilled onions on it. The downside is that you can't control the temp on it so you have to keep an eye on what your making. I'm so glad I bought it despite the lack of temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Mira Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it use to be !
customer_reviews.text: We had one of the original ones. It was heavier and seemed to hold the heat a lot better, plus it cooked better. Not sure what they changed by making it lighter. But it's not as good as the original style.
customer_reviews.author: Aircooled VW's of the USA

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative to actually grilling
customer_reviews.text: Best alternative to actually grilling. Unlike grill pans, the runoff flows away to the catch tray. Calling it 2-serving is pushing it though. Will do 2 hamburgers but even a 0.7 lb steak barely fits. Been able to mostly clean it with a paper towel but it does need occasional scraping with a wooden or plastic spoon. A scouring pad meant for Teflon should work as well. Has no ON/OFF switch. You turn it on by plugging it in.
customer_reviews.author: DAV

customer_reviews.title: What I say is what I mean!
customer_reviews.text: When I put that my items should be put on porch, I expect them to be put on the porch. This time the items were not put on my porch! Also wish the grill plates came off for cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: George Foreman Products are great and this is one of them. Great for two servings. I made two very large hamburgers. Wow! They grilled up very fast. Easy to clean. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amanda taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast without compromising the flavor!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Had one 15+ years ago and it's exactly the same cause it works and works well!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one or two people
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the originals years ago. Had I realized they were now so inexpensive along with free shipping I would have purchased a replacement well before this. Think of the amount of cleaning use save with a quick wipe while still warm. Think of the extra fat rendered using this instead of a frying pan. I am excited on both counts.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy McCann

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: It heats up fast but doesn't cook evenly. Cleaning is a pain and very difficult as you have to let it cool so grease is set by then. Grease also ends up under the lip and is difficult to clean out. If the small catch tray is not set right a mess happens. Keeping this but it's stored away and will only be used if I run out of burners.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Segura

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: I had a George Foreman grill for 10 years!!! Awesome!!! It finally quit working so I bought this one Don’t buy it it’s a piece of junk!! I threw it away!! Burns everything on the top side of grill and it’s just not made well. It’s sure not like the one I previously owner. Very dissatisfied and disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Debra Downey

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Incredible bargain for a great, easy to use grill. Cook two burgers very quickly. Chicken, too. Build quality is top notch. I can't imagine a better one for anywhere near this price.
customer_reviews.author: Marc McCord

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast and very easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little Grill!! Very convenient and easy to use!!! Make sure when you clean it, you use the right scrubber/sponge because it gets scratched and faded very easily, Other than that, it does cool well and fast!!! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul William E.

customer_reviews.title: top burns so bad that it almost started a fire within minutes
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice and it started burning so bad that I worried the fire alarms would go off. This is my second George Foreman that's had problems. I'm wondering what's going on?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use it several times a week!
customer_reviews.text: I use this little grill several times a week for hot dogs, steak, pork chops, burgers. So handy, everything is cooked perfectly and quickly since it cooks both sides at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: onecent121

customer_reviews.title: Good, quick, convenient but not great.
customer_reviews.text: And it could be great with these improvements: -a better non-stick coating -AN ON/OFF SWITCH!!!!! -a longer cord- the cord is short and there is no on/off switch so I have to use an extension cord with it and it turns on and off by plugging and unplugging it. -make it safer to clean somehow- the cord does not detach -better warnings around where it gets really hot I just dropped mine and I am ordering a new one because I like how it cooks but the above items are definite problems to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Thanks George
customer_reviews.text: I love George Foreman grills!!! I've had several different Foreman grills and I have gotten so much use out of all of them. They cook your food quickly, and are extremely convenient and easy to use. They're great to use on those sticky summer days/nights when it's too hot to cook and the non-stick plates make them very easy to clean as well. I particularly love this smaller model, (this is my third one), because I have a very small kitchen and it doesn't take over my counter. Will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: DeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this to replace my old one I had for many years. It is quite small but perfect for my two person household. I could fit 3 nice sized chicken breasts on it. They turned out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: It's good for a quick meal. We use it for everything from burgers to paninis. The heat is a bit uneven and it has started to make a clicking noise. Assuming it is coming from the heating element. Anyway, not bad overall and the noise doesn't seem to be effecting anything.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani J. Boso

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use grill and panini press
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use grill and panini press. Good to make panini for 1-2 people. Hard to clean when gets cold to try to clean it when it's warm.
customer_reviews.author: tama

customer_reviews.title: just right size
customer_reviews.text: I had a larger grill and this one is just right for one person. works like the big one and easier to store.
customer_reviews.author: kathy  c

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen essential
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 since it was first introduced years ago. Ive also owned the larger size, but this one remains my favorite go-to. Practical & effective with ease of use and cleaning. Always a positive experience with this grill!
customer_reviews.author: KazC

customer_reviews.title: It would have been better had the top plate been the same as the ...
customer_reviews.text: The price in this case really tells the story. It's a no frills very cheap unit. While it does cook , it's the unit you need to watch. The top plate is much thinner then the bottom plate. Food sticks to the top and burns before the bottom because the top has almost no ridges. It would have been better had the top plate been the same as the bottom. The lid also gets very hot. be careful. The cord is very short. The tray to catch the grease is to small and fits under the bottom plate to close. Its to high or the unit sits to low. Would not buy it again. Search for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Mordy

customer_reviews.title: Nonstick surface poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nonstick surface isn't good quality. Cooks my chicken good but I don't see this lasting long because of the poor quality of the nonstick surface.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Miller

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this mini GF!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mini George Forman! It’s small and cute and works perfectly for small pork chops, burgers, chicken breasts, and even for grilling sandwiches! I would recommend if you are cooking for 1 or 2 people, though, cooking burgers feels like a lightning round they cook so fast! Don’t believe any of the bad reviews because I’ve had this for 10 months and it looks and works just like the first day I got it.
customer_reviews.author: SJP

customer_reviews.title: Easy burgers
customer_reviews.text: Easy burgers. One at a time, though. The Costco frozen patties are so large, you cannot fit two of them at a time on this grill.
customer_reviews.author: K O'Toole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small amounts and small spaces to keep it.
customer_reviews.text: Correctly advertised as good for 1 or 2 people and doesn’t take up a lot of space! I find it washes up easily when cool and heats up well enough to cook a burger or chicken breast well. Wouldn’t try to do thick meat on it.
customer_reviews.author: Average consumer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery also melts the cheese on my sandwiches super melty. Will definetly consider buying again also maybe a bigger one next time just cause this one is only big for one sandwich at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia sierra

customer_reviews.title: Great little kitchen tool - I use my when traveling.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool for cooking salmon (and other fish filets). I always use parchment paper to make cleaning up a breeze. It provides enough heat to cook a froze salmon filet (from Costco) in 8 minutes. I very much recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cruise

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful compact unit, perfect for work or small kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased at least a dozen foreman grills and have never been disappointed. So basic, so simple, yet so useful. This is one of the simpler smaller more economical units, and as such does not have the removable or interchangeable plates. But it works like a charm. Cleaning is as simple as warming up the unit, and then using a dry or wet cloth (or even kleenex) and just wiping it down the grooves. In addition to your standard usage (grilling meats, sandwiches, etc), you can get very creative. I have cooked vegetables, including sliced potatoes on here that come out great. Even warming some dessert items, such as brownies or cookies, come out great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Haydar

customer_reviews.title: George Foreman Counter top size
customer_reviews.text: Size is convenient for apt living. Seems to cook well. I will be trying my others items of bread and fruit to see its quality. Thinner pieces I recommend verses thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Scallops !!
customer_reviews.text: For years I've been trying to find an easy way to cook scallops. They're odd because of all the water in them. This sloped grill is perfect for draining water while cooking. It makes perfect seared scallops !
customer_reviews.author: tassojunior

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking
customer_reviews.text: This has made my life so much easier for cooking. Now I don't have to use multiple pans just this George Foreman grill.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Weird smell?
customer_reviews.text: Before even plugging this thing in, it smelled kind of off. Then once it started heating up it emitted this very strong chemically / burning plastic sort of scent. I tried letting it heat up for a while to see if the scent would go away, I tried washing and wiping it down, and still there. I attempted making a panini on it and while it does work, I'm too scared to try to eat it! Who knows what sort of toxins are getting put into the food. Does not feel safe.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Good, I keep it on the counter.
customer_reviews.text: Frozen burgers, chicken breasts and tenderloins, hot dogs, ... Save a pan.
customer_reviews.author: Hetz3

customer_reviews.title: Will always buy George foreman grills
customer_reviews.text: George foreman grills never disappoint me. Great little grill. Only two burgers fit at once but they cook so quickly it doesn't even matter.
customer_reviews.author: Blake P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great for price, I do wish the grill was a little bigger as it is quite small. I will update when I have tried cooking burgers on it.
customer_reviews.author: AxL

customer_reviews.title: ... only use for hot dogs because they come so good on a foreman
customer_reviews.text: I only use for hot dogs because they come so good on a foreman. This one is small and convenient because it stores in small space and is light to grab and pull right out. My last foreman was big and clunky and the Teflon was wearing off.
customer_reviews.author: martina rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: To say this is two servings is stretching it quite a bit. You can do one hamburger patty at a time on this thing. But it does do a good job on small steaks. It is not as easy to clean as they suggest because the grease drips around the edge and gets in between the two halves. Overall I am happy with the Foreman grill, but I'd go with a larger one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: I loved it
customer_reviews.text: This George Foreman classic plate ended up being my favorite way to cook. I can't believe how easy it is to cook food on. It cooks food that is frozen or not frozen. It makes perfect grilled chicken breast and burgers. I feel like I got a lot more value than I anticipated. I think that anyone looking for a new way to cook that isn't a professional cook should buy this. It was literally my first time cooking chicken on this. I'll always remember it.
customer_reviews.author: Lexxie2004

customer_reviews.title: price point is very good and the quality is very good
customer_reviews.text: Just fired it up and it cooked the hamburgers just perfect. What i like best was it filled up the grease catcher which meant that my wife an I did not have to digest this bad stuff. Easy to clean but do the cleaning while it is still hot or if u like u can turn the unit back on later and clean it. This is the perfect size for two people or just one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Garrard

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Still getting the hang of using my new cooking toy so I’ll come back to give a later update on whether it deserves five stars or not
customer_reviews.author: Shequora

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Healthy Meals
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my work break room to make heated sandwiches on cold days. I ended up keeping at my house. I place a fool sheet on the top and bottom for easy cleanup, and add chicken, spices and veggies for a quick, healthy, roasted meal.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh James

customer_reviews.title: I GOT A DUD!
customer_reviews.text: I got this and loved it I used it may e 2 or 3 times, tops. However after the 3rd time it seemed to overheat and the lid puffed up and started smelling like melted plastic. I just got rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: arjeta xhepa

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Meals Fast! ❤ 🍔
customer_reviews.text: Compact, but powerful enough to prepare excellent meals fast. This is my third unit. The perfect option for food prep as well. I've also given this GM grill as a gift; both recipients loved it.
customer_reviews.author: TeriFLA

product_meta.title: George Foreman 2-Serving Classic Plate Electric Indoor Grill and Panini Press, Black, GR10B
product_meta.description:
It’s the kitchen appliance that changed the grilling game forever. The George Foreman 2-Serving Classic Plate Grill and Panini Press delivers fast grilling and delicious results for steak, burgers, chicken, veggies, and more. The proprietary sloped surface helps remove fat during cooking, and the George Tough nonstick coating wipes clean after every use. The compact grill’s dual contact heating speeds up grilling to get food on the table in record time. What will you make on your George Foreman Grill?

*from 1/4lb. uncooked 80/20 ground chuck
feature_bullets: 2 Servings - Tight on countertop space? This grill is your answer. It fits two servings of your grilled favorites, and it’s perfect for small apartments and couples
Classic Plate Grill - This is the original George Foreman Grill. The durable grill plates give you lean, mean grilling power for all your favorite foods
George Tough Nonstick Coating - There’s a lot to love about this nonstick coating. It’s durable, easy to clean, and reduces the need for butter and oil
Fat-Removing Slope - It’s the sure sign of a George Foreman Grill. The sloped grilling surface helps remove up to 42% of fat* for leaner, tasty meals
Drip Tray - The dishwasher-safe drip tray collects excess fat and grease so you don’t have to, How nice is that?

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,938 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
